meanings.definition: A material attached to the outside of a building to protect it from the weather.
meanings.sent1: The siding on the house kept the rain out.
meanings.sent2: The old barn had wooden siding that needed painting.
meanings.sent3: The siding on the shed decided to play hide and seek with the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like siding, shielding her emotions from the world.
meanings.sent5: The bright blue siding made the house stand out on the street.

meanings.definition: A piece of material used to cover the sides of something.
meanings.sent1: He used metal siding to protect the edges of the table.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter nailed the siding onto the frame of the cabinet.
meanings.sent3: The siding on the bookshelf was shy and preferred to stay hidden.
meanings.sent4: His words were like siding, covering up the true meaning behind them.
meanings.sent5: The colorful siding added a touch of elegance to the room.

meanings.definition: A position taken in a dispute or argument.
meanings.sent1: She firmly stood by her siding in the debate.
meanings.sent2: The team leader presented a strong siding during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The siding in the argument suddenly changed, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: His siding was like a shield, protecting his beliefs from criticism.
meanings.sent5: Taking a siding in the discussion helped clarify his stance.
